summary: the scene near the end of captain marvel where that white boy kree is like "ARE YOU GONNA LET UR EMOTIONS GET THE BEST OF YOU...
body: the scene near the end of captain marvel where that white boy kree is like “ARE YOU GONNA LET UR EMOTIONS GET THE BEST OF YOU AGAIN?” like, mocking all those people who call women overly emotional… and then shes standing there perfectly calm while he yells and bounces around with his fists up, then interrupts him by power punching him in the chest… i felt that in my soul

summary: I ❤️ed Captain Marvel! Brie Larson was FANtastic...Sam Jackson was 😆, BUT...WHAT’S UP W/ THE SKRULLS MAN?! I MEAN DAMN! I kept...
body: I ❤️ed Captain Marvel! Brie Larson was FANtastic…Sam Jackson was 😆, BUT…WHAT’S UP W/ THE SKRULLS MAN?! I MEAN DAMN! I kept waiting for THAT end credit scene where…YA KNOW!!!😉Anywayz…what I’ve DEF learned during my comic book reading years…YOU CAN’T TRUST SKRULLS!!! Sometimes they don’t even know they’re BAD GUYS! I STILL have my doubts🤔…

body:
Why I loved Captain Marvel

So this is my first post here, bear with me. I just saw the film and wanted to type up some thoughts, this will be very vague so should be spoiler free:

  • The new opening dedicated to Stan. Perfection!
  • The music was the perfect selection between Grunge and general 90s music. The two R.E.M. songs alone had me sold. Bonus: Fury singing Postman!
  • Marvel was able to tie up all lose ends and set up for Endgame all the while introducing the first hero to the MCU.
  • Strong female characters!
  • A good storyline that kept the movie interesting and different from all the regular intro films to new heroes.
  • Great balance between action and story. The action was cool, and fun to watch but it didn’t overwhelm and take away from the film. This felt like the Ant-Man films where there is more room for plot and less action as we usually get in the Avengers films.
  • The visual effects were awesome while not overwhelming. They added well to the movie while not stealing the show.
  • All the 90s references where brilliantly done without overdoing it but still keeping true to the time period.
  • THE CAT.
  • The post credit scenes! Can’t believe people still walk out before… But both scenes where great.

All in all, it was a great film experience and I am ready to see more Captain Marvel in Endgame.

blog.name: fyeah-anya-corazon
blog.title: ¡F-Yeah Anya Corazón!
blog.description: A appreciation blog for the one and only Anya Corazón, THE GOSH-DARNED SPIDER-GIRL!  *Feel free to use my gifs any way you want*

summary:
To celebrate the release of Captain Marvel, a throwback to the time when Anya became Carol's daughter sidekick!
Anya Corazon...
body:
To celebrate the release of Captain Marvel, a throwback to the time when Anya became Carol’s daughter sidekick!

Anya Corazon also happens to be one of Brie Larson’s favorite superheroes, and has said that her Spider-Girl is one of her favorite comic books! Needles to say, I would die if Anya shows up in the sequel! :D

Bonus: Anya and the motherflerken cat.

blog.name: htgawparksandrec
blog.title: Noble Land Mermaid
blog.description:
Short version: Multifandom-blog. Long version: I love Parks and Rec, Doctor Who, HTGAWM, Brooklyn Nine-Nine, Sherlock, Sense8, Torchwood, Scandal, and some other stuff. Occasional appearances of NCIS, OUAT, H50, NCIS:LA, The Mentalist,... I'm a big Marvel-fan, Potterhead, adore Skulduggery Pleasant, Divergent, and some other book stuff.
My OTPs are Flaurel, Remadora, Nine/Rose, Sherlolly, Benslie, Andy/April, Peraltiago, and many more, so there's gonna be a lot of that. My only Notps are Johnlock and Wes/Laurel, so don't bother looking for that.
All year round there's a chance of Eurovision content on here, the worst months are from March-June.
